alert.note: Alert for Hancock (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 18 at 4:24PM EST until December 19 at 4:12PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of DownEast, East Central, and North Central Maine, including the following counties, in DownEast Maine, Hancock and Washington. In East Central Maine, Penobscot. In North Central Maine, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 424 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bangor, Old Town, Bucksport, Dover-Foxcroft, Dexter, Newport, Calais, Howland, Vanceboro, Orono, Brewer, Hampden, Hermon, Corinth, Veazie, Dedham, Kenduskeag, Perry, Pembroke and Princeton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
